poem:
"Voices Reclaimed"

Instruments honed finely resonate,
once silenced, now singing. The
spangled prism of opera, no longer 
a kept dove. 

Beneath the footlight's glare,
a radical renaissance blooms.
The once marionettes, assume the 
master's voice.

The questions sink deep,
as hardened hearts thaw in this 
spring of rethinking.

A specter, donned in British fog,
uncovers long-muted songs.
In defiance, they answer.
